events.title: Publication of El Maestro
events.summary: Milán's Libro de música de vihuela de mano, titled El Maestro, was printed in December 1536 and dedicated to King John III of Portugal. This collection is significant as it is the first of its kind in history and includes a range of compositions designed for students of the vihuela, indicating a structured approach to musical education.
events.fun_version: Milan's *Libro de música de vihuela de mano*, titled *El Maestro*, was printed in December 1536 and dedicated to King John III of Portugal. This collection is significant as it is the first of its kind in history and includes a range of compositions designed for students of the vihuela, indicating a structured approach to musical education.

events.title: Publication of El cortesano
events.summary: Milán’s last publication, El cortesano, provides a vivid and entertaining picture of life in the Valencian ducal court, reflecting the era's culture and societal norms. Although it contains no music, it serves as a valuable narrative by a professional musician, offering insights into court life during that time.
events.fun_version: Milan's last publication, "El cortesano," paints a vibrant picture of life in the Valencian ducal court, reflecting the era's culture and societal norms. While you won’t find any catchy tunes in there, it’s still a valuable narrative from a professional musician who thought, “Why not write a book instead of just playing the lute?” It offers plenty of juicy gossip about court life and is perfect for your next dinner party.
